Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.unittitle: Smith College Club of North Shore records
did.abstract: The Smith College Club of North Shore formed as a fusion between the Lynn Smith Club (founded 1917) and the Salem Smith Club (founded 1919), at the suggestion of the Alumnae Association, in 1934. Its records contain minutes, annual meeting reports, membership directories, event fliers, newspaper clippings, and correspondence of the Smith College Club of North Shore.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Smith College Club of North Shore formed as a fusion between the Lynn Smith Club (founded 1917) and the Salem Smith Club (founded 1919), at the suggestion of the Alumnae Association, in 1934. The early meetings of the groups were social and informal. The Smith Club of North Shore's ongoing Autumn Supper is its longstanding tradition, started in 1948. The supper provides a meal for both alumnae and prospective students, and is the first event in the Club's active year. Annual fundraising events include Macadamia for Academia, begun in 1970, which is the Smith College Club of North Shore's spinoff of pecan sales. They also sell S'mints, begun in 1992, which are chocolates with a Grecourt Gate design. Notable Smith alumnae have participated in events for the Smith College Club of North Shore, such as Julia McWilliams Child (1934), who gave a lecture in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains meeting minutes from the 1920s to the late 2000s, annual reports, and documentation of many of the club's events through fliers and newspaper clippings. Most of the material is administrative and reflects minutes of club committees, changes in by-laws, and reports of different meetings and events. Additional materials are plays performed by the Lynn Smith Club at alumnae events during the 1930s, as well as Smith College publications about alumnae clubs and the college.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smith College Club of North Shore records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00310, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Smith College Club of North Shore records were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.
